name: Quilty
instructions:
1. Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass over ice and stir until chilled.
2. Strain into a double rocks glass over a large ice cube.
3. Garnish with lemon peel.
description: In this spirit-forward cocktail recipe, smoky whisky, mezcal, nutty amontillado sherry and bittersweet coffee liqueur are paired together.

ingredients.name: Mezcal
ingredients.description:
Mezcal is a distilled alcoholic beverage that originates from Mexico, known for its distinctive smoky flavor. It is made from the agave plant, primarily the species Agave espadin, although other agave varieties can be used. The production of mezcal involves roasting the agave hearts (piñas) in underground pits, which imparts a smoky character to the final product. After roasting, the agave is crushed, fermented, and then distilled, resulting in a spirit with a wide range of flavors, including earthy, fruity, and herbal notes.

The traditional production methods involve cooking the agave in earthen pits lined with lava rocks and filled with wood and charcoal. This underground roasting process gives mezcal its distinctive smoky taste.

Mezcal is produced in specific regions of Mexico, with Oaxaca being a particularly renowned area for its high-quality mezcals. The production of mezcal is regulated, and the spirit has a Denomination of Origin (DO) to ensure authenticity and quality.

Unlike some other agave spirits, such as tequila, which is made from Blue Agave, mezcal can be produced from a variety of agave types, contributing to the spirit's diversity.

Mezcal is deeply rooted in Mexican culture and has gained international recognition for its artisanal production methods and diverse flavor profile.

ingredients.name: Sherry
ingredients.description: Sherry is a fortified wine that originates from the Jerez region in southwestern Spain. It is made from white grapes, primarily the Palomino grape variety, and is known for its unique production process, diverse styles, and complex flavors. Sherry has a protected designation of origin (DO) status, meaning that only wines produced in the designated region can be labeled as Sherry.

ingredients.name: Coffee liqueur
ingredients.description: Coffee liqueur is a sweet and flavored liqueur that is infused with the rich and robust taste of coffee. It typically combines distilled spirits like vodka or rum with coffee extracts, sweeteners, and sometimes additional flavorings. Coffee liqueur is known for its dark color and the deep, complex flavor profile that includes the bold essence of coffee along with sweetness and often a touch of bitterness. It is a versatile ingredient used in various cocktails, desserts, and coffee-based beverages. Popular brands include Kahlúa and Tia Maria, and common cocktails featuring coffee liqueur include the White Russian and Espresso Martini.

ingredients.name: Bourbon Whiskey
ingredients.description:
A type of American whiskey, primarily made from corn and aged in new charred oak barrels. Bourbon has a sweet and full-bodied flavor profile.

To be labeled as bourbon, a whiskey must meet the following criteria:

1. Grain Mash Composition: Bourbon must be made from a grain mash that is at least 51% corn. The remaining portion of the mash can include other grains such as barley, rye, and wheat.

2. Distillation: Bourbon must be distilled to no more than 160 proof (80% alcohol by volume) and entered into the barrel for aging at no more than 125 proof (62.5% alcohol by volume).

3. Barrel Aging: Bourbon must be aged in new charred oak barrels. There is no minimum aging requirement for bourbon, but to be labeled as "straight bourbon," it must be aged for at least two years.

4. No Additives: Bourbon must not contain any additives except water to adjust the proof.

5. Bottling Strength: Bourbon must be bottled at a minimum of 80 proof (40% alcohol by volume).

6. Geographic Origin: While bourbon can be produced anywhere in the United States, it is strongly associated with Kentucky, and many consider Kentucky bourbon to be a distinctive category.

ingredients.name: Islay Scotch Whiskey
ingredients.description:
Islay Scotch refers to Scotch whisky that is produced on the Isle of Islay, which is one of the whisky-producing regions of Scotland. Islay whiskies are renowned for their distinctive and peaty character, often featuring robust and smoky flavors that set them apart from whiskies produced in other regions.

Well-known Islay distilleries include Ardbeg, Laphroaig, Lagavulin, and Bowmore, among others. Islay Scotch whiskies are appreciated by enthusiasts who enjoy the bold and distinctive flavor profile associated with the region. They are often enjoyed neat or with a splash of water to unlock the complexities of the spirit.
